image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from New Jersey; born in Perth Amboy, Middlesex County, N.J., August 22, 1905; attended the public schools of Perth Amboy; graduated from the Newark Normal School in 1927, the Rutgers Law School, Newark, N.J., in 1927, and Rutger University, New Brunswick, N.J., in 1928; was admitted to the bar in 1927 and began the practice of law in Perth Amboy; teacher in the public schools of Elizabeth, N.J., 1927-1934; mayor of Perth Amboy, 1934-1940; county clerk, Middlesex County, 1940-1954; secretary of state, State of New Jersey, 1954-1962; director and counsel of the Woodbridge National Bank, 1935-1962; elected as a Democrat to the Eighty-eighth and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1963-January 3, 1981); was not a candidate for reelection in 1980 to the Ninety-seventh Congress; was a resident of Perth Amboy, N.J., until his death on September 17, 1994.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Ralph Nader Congress Project. Citizens Look at Congress: Edward J. Patten, Democratic Representative from New Jersey. Washington, D. C.: Grossman Publishers, 1972.

researchRecord.name: 1921-1994, approximately 2 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Photographs (most black-and-white) and photograph albums, 1921?-1991, accompanied by three drawings; certificates, resolutions, proclamations and testimonials, 1927-1994; political ephemera, 1928-1970s; miscellaneous correspondence, 1925-1994; press clippings, 1936-1988; and a scrapbook, 1954-1958. The bulk of the papers pertains to Patten's political career, especially his service in the U.S. Congress. The correspondence consistly chiefly of letters from U.S. political figures (e.g., Walter Mondale) and New Jersey political figures (e.g., Robert B. Meyner). It includes letters of condolence sent following Patten's death.

recordLocation.name: Alexander Library Department of Special Collections and Archives

researchRecord.name: 1963-1980, 37 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of former Congressman Edward Patten include committee correspondence (1969-1970, 1975-1980), subject correspondence (1976-1980), project file, press releases, clippings, photos, and other papers.

recordLocation.name: Alexander Library Department of Special Collections and Archives
